javadoc:
This is the interface for a correlator that associates addresses from one program with
 addresses from another program or it can associate addresses from one part of a program 
 with addresses from another part of the same program. Given an address from the address set
 in the first program it determines the matching address from the address set for the second 
 program if possible.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the program containing the first set of addresses.
@return the program for the first set of addresses.
methods.name: getFirstProgram
methods.comment: Gets the program containing the first set of addresses.

return.comment: the program for the first set of addresses.

methods.name: getSecondProgram
methods.comment:
Gets the program containing the second set of addresses.
 This program may be different from or the same as the first program.

return.comment: the program for the second set of addresses.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the first set of addresses for this correlator.
@return the first set of addresses.
methods.name: getAddressesInFirst
methods.comment: Gets the first set of addresses for this correlator.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the second set of addresses for this correlator.
@return the second set of addresses.
methods.name: getAddressesInSecond
methods.comment: Gets the second set of addresses for this correlator.

methods.name: getAddressInSecond
methods.comment: Determine the address from the second set that matches the specified address in the first set.

params.name: addressInFirst
params.comment: the address in the first address set.

return.comment: the matching address in the second set or null if a match couldn't be determined.

methods.name: getAddressInFirst
methods.comment: Determine the address from the first set that matches the specified address in the second set.

params.name: addressInSecond
params.comment: the address in the second address set.

return.comment: the matching address in the first set or null if a match couldn't be determined.

name: ListingAddressCorrelation
comment:
This is the interface for a correlator that associates addresses from one program with
 addresses from another program or it can associate addresses from one part of a program 
 with addresses from another part of the same program. Given an address from the address set
 in the first program it determines the matching address from the address set for the second 
 program if possible.
